question.questiontext: Which of the following correctly describes independent assortment in meiosis? <br/ > (1) Exchange of genetic materials between sister chromatids. <br/ > (2) Rearrangement of chromosomes. <br/ > (3) Rearrangement of alleles along the chromosome.

answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Exchange of genetic materials between sister chromatids occurs in crossing over.
CORRECT! Independent assortment refers to the random separation of homologous chromosomes during meiosis.
INCORRECT! Exchange of genetic materials between sister chromatids occurs in crossing over.
INCORRECT! Exchange of genetic materials between sister chromatids occurs in crossing over. Rearrangement of alleles along the chromosome occurs in mutation.
